WorkItem.Description:
An error occurred creating the configuration section handler for environmentDataSection: Could not load type 'TestCaseAutomation.EnvironmentDataSection' from assembly 'System.Configuration, Version=2.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a'. (Certification_Tests.dll.config line 5)
 
Not sure why it's looking in System.Configuration for this...
 
This occurs using the default configuration generated by the CSD generator.  The app.config looks like:
<configSections>
    <section name="testCasesData" type="TestCaseAutomation.TestCasesData"/>
    <section name="environmentDataSection" type="TestCaseAutomation.EnvironmentDataSection"/>
  </configSections>
 
If I change add the assembly name as follows:
<configSections>
    <section name="testCasesData" type="TestCaseAutomation.TestCasesData, TestCaseConfiguration"/>
    <section name="environmentDataSection" type="TestCaseAutomation.EnvironmentDataSection, TestCaseConfiguration"/>
  </configSections>
 
It works fine...

Comments.Message: Sounds like you are using VB? If so I have seen the same issue in testing but I have not figure out a good work around for it yet.

Yes, the sample configuration file is actually invalid when it's generated. However, there's no easy way to know your assembly name during the generation, so there's no easy way for us to put it in. That is why the property "Assembly Name" was added to the CSD diagram. Right click the diagram (not any of the elements, but the diagram itself) and select "Properties". In its properties there should be a setting for that. Hope that helps.

Would be nice to add a Validation error when saving the schema which at least notifies the user that AssemblyName is required to produce a valid configuration file.  Just like requiring Namespaces and keys...

Thanks
